question: 初めて
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>初</ja> means "first" This word means <vocabulary>for the first time</vocabulary>. Think of <ja>めて</ja> as "meet." Then think "when we met <vocabulary>for the first time</vocabulary> ____ happened."
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the kun'yomi, which you didn't learn with the kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you out. What are you beginning? You are beginning <reading>Haj</reading> (<ja>はじ</ja>). (Haj is the fifth pillar of Islam, and is a pilgrimage to Mecca during the month of Dhu al-Hijja).
